body.p:
To his Exlencey B Magoffin Gov of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your Petitioner Jas H Armstrong would Represent that he was fined before O. M. Ronnal Justice of the Peace in & for Shelby Cty the sum of six Dollars & Sixty two Cents for Breach of the Peace Commited on Election Day the facts of the Case is this that he was attending Election & a man by the name of Lang attackted him & chased him by using insulting Language & drawing a knife on him & attempting to Stab him Cutting his Cote & making a flesh wound on the hand when he knocked the said Lang Down & administered such chastisement to him as was nessary to cause him to desist from further attempts on his Life that they were both taken up before the said Justice & after hearing the Law Evidence the said Justice constructed the Jury that it made no difrence who begun the fight or what Lang Dun that they must fine your Petitioner in order to Stop fighting now he state that he is advised that he had a perfict Right to do what he did that he vialated no Law & Should not be Required to pay Any fine it is true that the fine is small but the principle is the same
& that the way times is it harder to pay the amount assessed then $20 a short time back he states that he is a young man having a widowed mother & childrin to suport & that if he was Justifiable in what he did as he clarly thinks he was it would be wrong for him to have to pay Any thing wherefore he prays your Excelency will Remit said fine.
Sworn to before me by Jas H Armstrong this 9th day of Sept 1861
A G Roberts N P P C

this affiant states that he saw the fight between the Pet & Lang on Election day that Lang Cut at Armstrong two or three one times with a knife before he Struck Lang & that what Armstrong did was in defence of his Life
Sworn to before me by Richard Kirk This Octo 14th 1861
J. H. Raddish J. P. F. C

Shelby J. P.
Jas H Armstrong
Vs } Pet.
$6.62 } Breach
Commonwealth
Remitted
B. M.
Issd Nov. 1. 1861
